Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2012 03:29AM Ellendou wrote: I hope you don't mind me putting my two cents in here....will let you know as the days go on about the SE....started my first treatment on the 22 of June....so today was my second and only have two more to go  When I am having the   Taxotere, they give me big frozen mitts and also big thick frozen slippers, and I was told if I wanted to use nailpolish it had to be clear, so they can check my nails. I also suck on ice and drink lots of cold water during the treatment. Just tired and think I am worn out tonight, it is a one hour drive each way for my Chemo and then we met DD and DS for lunch, and wanted to stop at a shoe store, hat store and craft store, so guess that is why I am wiped.

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2012 04:09PM Ellendou wrote: Hi Gail - my name is Ellen and I found out I had Cancer on the 3rd of May, confirmed in the right breast and not sure of the cells in the lieft side....I was like you and don't think I heard anything after that.  I had to have another biopsy on the left side, and it was confirmed cancer was there also.  I had my surgery and sentinel biopsy on both sides on the 17th of May....now I am like you and waiting to hear what stage and what treatment I will have.....my appointment  is on the 13th of June.  I understand exactly how you are feeling, as I am the same way..I am also having alot of pain on the left side and it scares me...........Sending Hugs your way.

Posts.Content: Ellendou wrote: Went in for a regular mammogram and lumps were found on each side, had Ultrasound and biopsy the same day, then waited ten days for the results....came back cancer on the right side but did not know for sure what was on the left side.  Met with surgeon on the 4th - then had to have another biopsy on the left side on the 9th.....found out it was cancer also. Had lumpectomy and sentinel lymph node biopsy on each side on the 17th of June.  I have an appointment with the Surgeon on the 28th to find out what they have found........ and what the next step will be. I am having alot of pain in my  left breast, I am wearing a sports bra for support.  Also having trouble sleeping, I am not a back sleeper. I hope this makes sense, I am in such a state, just so much to take in in such a short length of time.  Dx 5/3/2012, 1cm Surgery 5/17/2012 Lumpectomy: Left, Right; Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Sentinel Chemotherapy 6/22/2012 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Dx ILC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Radiation Therapy Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed.....not sure what is next.... Ellendou chrissyb

Posts.Content: May 26, 2012 12:52PM Ellendou wrote: Velo--  they have mentioned radiation but will not know for sure til I find out what kind of cancer it is.  I am hoping when I meet with the surgeon on Monday he can give me some answers to all my questions. My surgeon is gone for three weeks, so I will be seeing her assistant, which I am feeling uneasy about...but guess it can't be helped. I am taking ES tylenol and Naproxen for the pain and being very careful how I move, had to understand why the right breast does not hurt very much but the left one hurts something terrible. Do you know when we are referred to an oncologist?  I live in a very small community so have to travel into Edmonton for everything, which is a real pain - 4 hours away. When is your next visit with the Dr? Sending Hugs and Prayers.
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed.....not sure what is next.... Ellendou chrissyb
